data.title: Great sushi and atmosphere!
data.text: This is my third time here from out of town and this is the best sushi. Sat at bar and exceptional service! Fantastic owners who take a true interest in their food and service. Hibachi is available as is outdoor seating. Would like to try it on a weekend to go upstairs. If I could rate higher I would!

data.title: Good meal great service
data.text: Decided to have Lunch here on Saturday with my daughter on the spur of the moment. We have visited Tomorrow Sushi Bar and Grill numerous times and have never been disappointed. We had an assorted sashimi platter and a Spicy Lady Roll. Both dishes were good as is normally the case at Tomo  and the service was excellent without being overbearing. We were promptly seated, served and received our dishes with a minimum of wait. The restaurant was half full with a good mixture of young and old patrons. this is not a cheap sushi establishment but as with everything you get what you pay for, so no complaints just be prepared for a bill higher than other sushi bars. Only gripe, lose the TV, a personal bug bear of mine.

data.title: Best Pleasanton Sushi
data.text: This by far is the best Sushi in Pleasanton!! Best Service too!! They really have the best tempura you will ever try. It is some of the best sushi you will experience anywhere.

data.title: Good stuff.
data.text: Love the golden gate roll and the big boat. They are very flexible with substations. The staff is friendly. Please try the monkey's balls and the dragon rolls

data.title: New Ownership
data.text: The rolls are interesting and good.  Our guests ordered straight-up sushi and were disappointed with it calling it boring.  To each his own.

data.title: Excellent Customer Service and gluten free soy sauce
data.text: Amen to gluten free sushi! I'm surprised when I happen upon another sushi restaurant that doesn't have gluten free soy sauce. Luckily Tomo isn't one of those. We arrived after lunch. They were supposed to be closed but once we walked in, they made accommodations for us and had food and drinks in front of us within five minutes.  Big smiles on their faces. Really friendly people. The California rolls and miso soup were excellent. We didn't order anything else, so I can't comment further. But it was real crab, gluten free soy sauce, it was fast and it was delicious.

data.title: Freshest Sushi this side of Japan.
data.text: This is a small intimate restaurant with both table and bar style seating.  The menu is extensive and all the fish are fresh.  Also, both the pork and chicken Kotomatsu are mild and very soft, can eat with chopsticks alone, no fork needed.

data.title: Great Lunch
data.text:
This Japanese Restaurant is AWESOME!! My Husband and I have been going there for years, its clean and May (I believe she is one of the owners) works the sushi bar and we usually get Ahi Shashmi Tuna (seard) salad, it is so tasty you will love this one.

Pam F.

data.title: It's like being in Japan...
data.text: I lived in Japan for a number of years and Tomo's is hands down the most authentic Japanese cuisine in the East Bay. Some reviews have rated the value at a 3 or 4, but if appreciated the trouble the owners go through to only sell high quality food you would understand that you are getting great value at Tomo's. There is not a bad dish on the menu. If you want to experience REAL Japanese food (not Billy Bob's cream cheese Americana made up crappy hand roll that NO sushi bar in Japan would dare have on their menu) then check out this sushi bar. Great place to take a date for a terrific dinner with the option of an evening stroll through downtown Pleasanton!
